title: Fenstrider witch
data:

| fenstrider witch H [![Fenstrider witch.png](/images/5/5d/Fenstrider_witch.png)](/File:Fenstrider_witch.png) |                                                                                                                                                                                |

| Attack1                                                                                                     | 25 ([hit](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))                                                                                              |
| Attack2                                                                                                     | 25 ([kick](/Attack_type "Attack type"): [plain](/Attack_flavour "Attack flavour"))                                                                                             |
| [Resistances](/Resistance "Resistance")                                                                     | [rPois+](/Poison "Poison") [rN+](/Negative_energy "Negative energy")                                                                                                           |

|   |                                                                                                                                                            |
| - | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | Followers of the ancient swamp ways, these witches rise above the muck and mire on a pair of stilt-like chicken legs. They are masters of pain and poison. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Fenstrider witches** are hexing, supportive casters of [the Swamp](/The_Swamp "The Swamp"). [Paralysis](/Paralysis "Paralysis") can be deadly in every branch; the Swamp is no exception. If you get into melee range, they can inflict [Agony](/Agony "Agony") on you. High [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower") is recommended to deal with them. When killed, their corpses may form into usable [wands](/Wand "Wand") (100% per [corpse](/Corpse "Corpse"), or a net 50% chance).

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                       |                                                     |
| :---------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Paralyze](/Paralyze "Paralyze")                      | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Agonizing Touch](/Agonizing_Touch "Agonizing Touch") | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Hurl Sludge](/Hurl_Sludge "Hurl Sludge") (3d15)      | [Wizard flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Paralyse is a very scary spell, unless you have the willpower to resist it. Getting paralysed next to a group of monsters can instantly kill you.

- Unlike other monsters, witches have the melee version of the [Agony](/Agony "Agony") spell.

- Hurl Sludge creates a sludge tile where it lands, which lasts for 2-3 turns. Like [Eringya's Noxious Bog](/Eringya%27s_Noxious_Bog "Eringya's Noxious Bog"), any non-flying creature standing in sludge will take high amounts of poison damage. It otherwise acts as [shallow water](/Shallow_water "Shallow water"), giving a penalty to melee attacks and movement speed to a non-amphibious adventurer.

  - Don't try to fight a witch while standing in toxic sludge, unless you have both [poison resistance](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") and a lot of HP, or the ability to fly.
  - Hurl Sludge can replace staircases with sludge tiles. Watch out!

## History

- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Fenstrider witches did not drop wands on death.
- Fenstrider witches were added in [0.26](/0.26 "0.26").
html:
Fenstrider witch

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
fenstrider witch H 
HP 43-89
HD 16
XP 1882
Speed 10
AC 3
EV 15
Will 100
Attack1 25 (hit: plain)
Attack2 25 (kick: plain)


Resistances rPois+
rN+
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Giant
Type fenstrider witch, fenstrider witch
Flags See invisible
Warm-blooded
Speaks
Evil
Followers of the ancient swamp ways, these witches rise above the muck and mire on a pair of stilt-like chicken legs. They are masters of pain and poison.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Fenstrider witches are hexing, supportive casters of the Swamp. Paralysis can be deadly in every branch; the Swamp is no exception. If you get into melee range, they can inflict Agony on you. High willpower is recommended to deal with them. When killed, their corpses may form into usable wands (100% per corpse, or a net 50% chance).

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Paralyze Wizard flag
Slot2 Agonizing Touch Wizard flag
Slot3 Hurl Sludge (3d15) Wizard flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Paralyse is a very scary spell, unless you have the willpower to resist it. Getting paralysed next to a group of monsters can instantly kill you.
  • Unlike other monsters, witches have the melee version of the Agony spell.
  • Hurl Sludge creates a sludge tile where it lands, which lasts for 2-3 turns. Like Eringya's Noxious Bog, any non-flying creature standing in sludge will take high amounts of poison damage. It otherwise acts as shallow water, giving a penalty to melee attacks and movement speed to a non-amphibious adventurer.
    • Don't try to fight a witch while standing in toxic sludge, unless you have both poison resistance and a lot of HP, or the ability to fly.
    • Hurl Sludge can replace staircases with sludge tiles. Watch out!

History

  • Prior to 0.28, Fenstrider witches did not drop wands on death.
  • Fenstrider witches were added in 0.26.

rawPage:
{{version031}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Fenstrider witches''' are hexing, supportive casters of [[the Swamp]]. [[Paralysis]] can be deadly in every branch; the Swamp is no exception. If you get into melee range, they can inflict [[Agony]] on you. High [[willpower]] is recommended to deal with them. When killed, their corpses may form into usable [[wand]]s (100% per [[corpse]], or a net 50% chance).

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Paralyse is a very scary spell, unless you have the willpower to resist it. Getting paralysed next to a group of monsters can instantly kill you. 
*Unlike other monsters, witches have the melee version of the [[Agony]] spell.
*Hurl Sludge creates a sludge tile where it lands, which lasts for 2-3 turns. Like [[Eringya's Noxious Bog]], any non-flying creature standing in sludge will take high amounts of poison damage. It otherwise acts as [[shallow water]], giving a penalty to melee attacks and movement speed to a non-amphibious adventurer.
**Don't try to fight a witch while standing in toxic sludge, unless you have both [[poison resistance]] and a lot of HP, or the ability to fly.
**Hurl Sludge can replace staircases with sludge tiles. Watch out!

==History==
*Prior to [[0.28]], Fenstrider witches did not drop wands on death.
*Fenstrider witches were added in [[0.26]].
